posts.author: FighterFanatic
posts.content:
Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that overpowered? functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

How do other DMs balance encounters that involve overpowered?? I find it either makes combats too easy or too difficult.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use overpowered? to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about overpowered?. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with overpowered? that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
